shorttext.p: Four years after taking a bullet in the head at her own wedding, The Bride emerges from a coma and decides it's time for payback with a vengeance! Having been gunned down by her former boss Bill and his deadly squad of international assassins, it's a kill-or-be-killed fight she didn't start but is determined to finish.

In the year 180, the death of emperor Marcus Aurelius throws the Roman Empire into chaos. Maximus is one of the Roman army's most capable and trusted generals and a key advisor to the emperor. As Marcus' devious son Commodus ascends to the throne, Maximus is set to be executed. He escapes, but is captured by slave traders.

Servilia mourns the death of Brutus, killed at Phillipi. She kneels in front of Atia's door chanting repeatedly for justice. Although Atia ignores her initially, the incessant chanting attracts a crowd of pleb onlookers and annoys Atia.

Four years after taking a bullet in the head at her own wedding, The Bride emerges from a coma and decides it's time for payback with a vengeance! Having been gunned down by her former boss Bill and his deadly squad of international assassins, it's a kill-or-be-killed fight she didn't start but is determined to finish.

Joey and Eddie's emotional and sexual relationship is played out on stage during a counseling center benefit. At the same event, Jack and David deal with the insecurities in their relationship, Jen opens up to C.J. about Grams' cancer, and a sober Audrey returns to Boston and surprises everyone at the benefit.

It is the future, and humans are divided into two groups: the thinkers, who make plans (but don't know how anything works), and the workers, who achieve goals (but don't have the vision). Completely separate, neither group is complete, but together they make a whole. One man from the thinkers dares visit the underground where the workers toil, and is astonished by what he sees.

Clown fish Nemo is captured by a scuba diver and taken to live in a dentist office's fish tank. Marlin and his new absent-minded friend Dory set off across the ocean to find Nemo, while Nemo and his tankmates scheme on how to get out of the tank before he becomes the dentist's niece's new pet.

A teenager arrives who may be Meade-related. Also Henry comes back to propose to Betty, as well as Gio asking her to go to Rome with him for a holiday. Wilhelmina takes over Daniel as editor-in-chief. Lindsay Lohan is set to play an old schoolmate of Betty's.

Servilia mourns the death of Brutus, killed at Phillipi. She kneels in front of Atia's door chanting repeatedly for justice. Although Atia ignores her initially, the incessant chanting attracts a crowd of pleb onlookers and annoys Atia.

This is the story of three gentle persons: Paul Rivers an ailing mathematician lovelessly married to an English emigree, Christina Peck, an upper-middle-class suburban housewife, happily married and mother of two little girls, and Jack Jordan, an ex-convict who has found in his Christian faith the strength to raise a family.

The gang breaks into the school swimming pool for an impromptu night of fun, but when a member of their group nearly drowns, the school threatens to expel the person responsible for the break-in. Meanwhile Chuck continues to blackmail Blair which causes strain on her already fragile relationship with Nate.

Joey and Eddie's emotional and sexual relationship is played out on stage during a counseling center benefit. At the same event, Jack and David deal with the insecurities in their relationship, Jen opens up to C.J. about Grams' cancer, and a sober Audrey returns to Boston and surprises everyone at the benefit.

Louisiana gets its first vampire visitor, Bill Compton, whose arrival creates a wave of interest, fear and excitement. Particularly in Sookie, who is thrilled to discover she can't hear Bill's innermost thoughts. She later forms a bond with the bloodsucker, after rescuing him from two opportunistic thieves.

Princess Leia is held hostage by the evil Imperial forces in their effort to take over the Galactic Empire. Venturesome Luke Skywalker and dashing Captain Han Solo team together with the lovable robotic duo, R2-D2 and C-3PO, to rescue the beautiful princess and restore justice in the Empire.
Season 3, Ep. 13: Art of the Deal

Michael and Lincoln must hand over Whistler to Gretchen so they can save LJ and Sofia's lives. Mahone seizes a golden opportunity. Meanwhile, T-Bag shows Sona who's boss and a familiar face enters Sona as another leaves it in a body bag.

Betty discovers a secret, leading her to re-evaluate her marital situation. Peggy gets promoted but receives news that may interfere with her career. Don's professional and private lives affects each other in curious ways as he's left to fend for himself.

Scrooge buys one of Glomgold's islands housing a diamond mine. Upon finding out, Glomgold has the diamond mine blown away from the island. Scrooge, Launchpad, and the nephews then go back in time to try to prevent the explosion, but end up going back 1 million years.

A man with a low IQ has accomplished great things in his life and been present during significant historic events - in each case, far exceeding what anyone imagined he could do. It is the story of a man who rose above his challenges, and who proved that determination, courage, and love are more important than ability.

This is the story of three gentle persons: Paul Rivers an ailing mathematician lovelessly married to an English emigree, Christina Peck, an upper-middle-class suburban housewife, happily married and mother of two little girls, and Jack Jordan, an ex-convict who has found in his Christian faith the strength to raise a family.
